lead_paragraph: Doctors Without Borders said nearly 200 people died of malnutrition and illness since May 23 in northeastern Nigeria. Boko Haram attacks have displaced millions.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and DIONNE SEARCEY

headline.print_headline: Fleeing Boko Haram, and Dying of Hunger
headline.main: ‘Catastrophic’ Conditions Reported in Camp for People Fleeing Boko Haram

snippet: Doctors Without Borders said nearly 200 people died of malnutrition and illness since May 23 in northeastern Nigeria. Boko Haram attacks have displaced millions.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders says almost 200 people, including children, have died in northeastern Nigeria camp for refugees displaced by Boko Haram attacks; aid workers describe conditions in informal camp, where 24,000 people live and malnutrition is rampant, as humanitarian catastrophe.
